nodes.bodyText:
gradlew is for unix based OS, in windows it uses gradle.bat.
I don't think we need to show this, but if we do, it should be accurate.

Thanks, updated.
I think we should show it because we do something similar for iOS (Updating iOS native dependencies with pod install), and it aligns with the goal that the Capacitor CLI should be more transparent/informative.
this message is different from the others, all should look the same

createLocalProperties does more than running gradlew, so if you want to specify what's going on, the new message is still not correct. Anyway, I don't see the point of extending this message and add this complexity to say that it's running gradlew
also, not related to the PR, but it made me realize that we run gradlew in several places, but that won't work on windows

Good point. Maybe "Syncing Gradle" isn't the best message? In any case, I'll revert for now.

we run gradlew in several places, but that won't work on windows

Yeah, I noticed as well. We also aren't using cross-spawn which is necessary once subprocess invocations become more complex.
